credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Decoration of a panel
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. A variation of the scheme of -1439. The motif below has the width of teh panel. Upon a pedestal stands a circular, vaulted structure in the center of a hemi-circle. The lateral parts of the front of teh pedestal are projecting; upon them are sitting figures. Above the hemi-circle are scrolls from which two stems rise having above scrolls and on top an oval medallion with a standing figure. The scroll rising in teh center end in spirals above the medallions, framing a stem witha female half-figure and supporting the frame of a landscape. Above the latter are two crouching animals beside a medallion, with scrolls on top.
name: Drawing
